name: Longhirst Hall

reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever felt compelled to write a review on a site like this but I was really disappointed with my stay at Longhirst hall and feel the photographs on the website are very misleading. The grounds themselves are nice but once you get past the reception area the hotel rapidly deteriorates. Our bedroom was very basic, dated and in desperate need of decorating, to be honest I have stayed in much nicer 'budget' accommodation. Being British I didn't complain, mainly because I didn't want to spoil my birthday! Breakfast was equally disappointing, it was served 8-10am yet when we arrived at 9am there was very little food available in the continental section and staff had to be constantly asked by guests to stock up fruit juices, fruit bread etc. Whenever I have stayed in similar hotels there has always been a good selection of bread buns, croissants etc where as there was only bog standard sliced bread available here. Whilst the reception staff were very pleasant I felt that the restaurant staff ( at breakfast) seemed disinterested and obviously didn't want to be there. Would definitely not recommend!
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: 18 years old today ! lets have a celebration meal for our son, having originally planned an alternative venue I am a great believer in supporting local business so I booked a table for 5 in the Boyson Restaurant in this impressive hotel. Taking a later booking than that requested we arrived
reviews.title: Service With A Smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: at an unmanned reception after waiting a while we decided to follow signs before we met a member of staff in the corridors and subsequently being directed to the restaurant. After been shown our table I was somewhat disappointed in the minimal choice, we ordered the staff were very pleasant and shared the occasional joke the starters were served followed my our main course, a side dish was missing when raised we were advised you wont be charged for them small consolation when your waiting for something you were expected, an error was made with the wine choice served red as an alternative to white but this was quickly rectified. after this point things went downward the other quests had all left and it felt like we had also. A considerable delay was experienced in ordering our sweet dish and even longer delay in receiving our choices whilst somewhat disappointed in the actual experience the food was very nice tasting throughout. after we had finished we sat for a considerable time awaiting attention to no avail, having opened the kitchen door and shouted for attention a member of staff appeared and gave me directions towards the toilets which I never found the nearest I got was signage directing me but been greeted by a door with a sign saying "private party" I returned to the party who were all standing at entrance to restaurant awaiting attention, again I shouted in kitchen to no avail, we headed to reception to find it unmanned after a wait I took some paper and wrote my contact details for payment and we walked away - unbelievable - contact has been made and my account settled no apology merely defensive comments. After the Smile very little else in terms of customer service,
reviews.title: Better if you don't go in!

reviews.text: This hotel is set in magnificent gardens and the old hall is an impressive building. But you don't go in there. This hotel doesn't seem sure what it is there is a big empty office building tacked on the side and most of the hotel seems to be used only for conferences.
reviews.title: "Faulty" towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and guest restaurant are rather old and stuck out the back like an after thought, there is a really nice bar but it's shut and the one you can use is a of a mess with lots different areas. The food is not good and the choice is limited and the rooms are tired and dated.
reviews.title: Weekend Break at Longhirst Hall.

reviews.text: As we pulled up onto the grounds I thought to myself what a stunning place, we got into the reception everything looked nice and modern then as soon as we was given our keys we went down the corridor to join the main building itself then it felt like I had just time warped into the 1970s! The decor was tasteless and needed bringing forward to modern times! The corridors to our room was like being in a rat race! Up and down left and right! We opened the bedroom door to find what only I can describe as stepping into my grandmas bedroom! There was a massive stain on the wall! Absolutely no phone signal and the wifi just as bad! It was like being in a nuclear bunker! The tv signal was dreadful aswell forever up and down trying to get decent signal!
reviews.title: 70s throw back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a shower but the shower curtain isn't long enough so I stepped out of the shower into a floor full of water! The heating in the room was on full pelt even tho I had turned it off at the thermostat so had to have the window open all night listening to the birds sing and to make things worse our room was right next to the corridor entrance so whoever came through the door it would slam shut and make a right bang! Don't be fooled by the appearance of the grounds because all in all it is like the faulty towers! M swidrak
reviews.title: Felt like a tetanus was required on check out...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were bought a package here as a wedding gift for a 2 nights, Dinner, Bed and Breakfast. We only managed one night and even that was a struggle. Where to start with Longhirst. Firstly I'll list the positives, The grounds. They were very pleasant to walk around and i'm sure in summer it would be lovely to be able to pop out of your room and watch the cricket taking place. However, that is where my positives end. The staff, although keen on reception, seemed out of there depth and were confused when a couple like ourselves would arrive without a voucher. This should of rang alarm bells as any establishment that is requiring copious amounts of vouchers clientele to fill its rooms is obviously struggling. Our friends had booked us here as a treat and had even included our dog which was nice. However although the hotel accepted dogs we were placed in a room which couldn't of been placed any further from a door to the outside. Negotiating the maze of corridors with a dog while weddings are taking place near by is not a great experience. Once in the room itself things didn't improve. The bathroom had mould all round the floor, bath and shower. The suite itself had obviously not been updated since the building was put together and looked very dated. The walls in the bedroom were all scuffed and grubby, generally the room looked unkempt. On trying to make a cup of tea we discovered one of the cups had dirt/mould inside. Needless to say we kept out periods of time in the room to a minimum. We hoped the food would make up for the room so were looking forward to dinner. The menu read ok apart from everything is a supplement. You want potatoes, that's £2 please. You want vegetables, that's £2 please. Also as guests staying for 2 nights we would of expected more than 2 choices of starter and main. It would seem what you don't have the first night you would have on the second or repeat your first night! Again every table when seated were there on a cheap voucher deal as the waitresses busied themselves explain what each table had included and not included. The food on arrival was average. Flavours were a little bland and things should as pate should be served just chilled not straight from the fridge where what little flavour it had was killed by the cold. My main course of Beef was cooked well but the gravy over reduced and salty and the mashed potato overworked and like wallpaper paste. Once back in the room we settle down to relax to be disturbed by drilling on a lower floor at 10pm?! Only a short burst but very strange. When settling down to sleep the pillows were dull and lifeless and only 1 each. We were then woken at 1am by a wedding party being particularly noisy when heading back to there rooms. Not the hotels fault but on top of everything else led to a very poor sleep. On waking up we decided to head to breakfast. Our favourite meal of a stay away from home. Not on this occasion. On being seated we were told there would be a 20 minute wait on any hot food as the kitchen was struggling to cope. On surveying the 10 tables in the restaurant we were a little confused as to why serving this few they would be backed up but said no problem and headed for the continental table to pass some time. This lacked any real produce. A few mini boxes of cereal, bread for toasting yourself, a bowl of prunes and a few dried croissants was all that greeted you. Sticking with fruit juice we returned to our table to eventually receive our full english. My wifes arrived incorrect so had to be returned for another 5 minute wait. Once we were both able to tuck in it again was very average. The quality of the produce seemed to be lacking and generally again lacked flavour. After this final straw we decided we'd had enough and couldnt go through another day/night of the mediocrity on offer. This could be a good hotel if some investment was made but it seems content on being average at best and catering purely to the function rooms in the main hall. I'm sure the wedding services are better but as a guest of any wedding I would rather travel to a travellodge elsewhere.
reviews.title: Peace with Style

reviews.text: We didn't stay at the hotel but called in for Sunday lunch. The hall stands in beautiful grounds, entered through a tree lined drive. The building is an impressive country house in mellow sandstone.
reviews.title: Tired Rooms

reviews.text: Although we had not made a booking ,the staff were welcoming and accommodating. We chose to eat in the restaurant and were taken to a table for two. We were promptly served . The three course lunch menu offered a good choice of dishes, with a fish and vegetarian choice for the non meat eaters. I chose the black bream which was well cooked and nicely presented.
reviews.title: Great Wedding Venue, terrible hotel

reviews.text: In April my friends and I booked afternoon tea (see previous review from myself) to celebrate a friend's birthday and were left disappointed when a specifically requested gluten free tea was not provided. Management apologised and offered us a return visit free of charge. The manager's exact words were "I will personally take care of you on the day and will ensure you have a birthday themed, gluten free afternoon tea"
reviews.title: Totally spoiled not one, but two special occasions

reviews.text: We booked our return visit to coincide with another birthday in our group and were thoroughly looking forward to the visit.
reviews.title: Very poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival the bar and restaurant area were unattended and we had to go looking for staff, all of whom seemed not to have any record of our booking. Things were not looking good.
reviews.title: misses the target

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The barman who seated us and served us drinks was extremely friendly and soon returned with our afternoon teas. We reminded him of our gluten free request and he returned 15 mins later with my "tea". Yet again it was NOT afternoon tea, but a very dry sandwich, creme brûlée and some grated fruit in a small ramekin. The chef was asked to come out and speak to us, but really all he could do was apologise again and claim he had not been informed of the gluten free request and had therefore done what he could.
reviews.title: Quality is slipping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On leaving the venue we contacted main reception to speak to the duty manager who apologised again and said he would get the manager himself to contact us. Later in the week one of my friends spoke to the manager who again apologised, but claimed there was nothing else he could do.
reviews.title: very disappointing stay

reviews.text: Had a wonderful afternoon tea here. Got the deal from Groupon and it was fantastic. Excellent value and really lovely food. The surroundings are lovely and the service is first class. Lovely way to spend an afternoon. Will return again.
reviews.title: Lovely Afternoon Tea

reviews.text: had a 2 for 1 voucher for afternoon tea so made a a day of it and visited morpeth first. staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful, a slection of finger sandwiches, a fruit scone with f cream and jam and a few mini sweet treats were served with a pot of tea or coffee. not sure if you'd get more had it not been 2 4 1, but it was ample for two, a very pleasant afternoon, however, not sure i'd pay a full £13 per head, but would def return on a special offer.
reviews.title: very pleasant afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely grounds -comfortable room -quiet with view of woods and green grass - very good cooked breakfast . We ate in the first night and the meal was fine . However such a pity that
reviews.title: 2 day stay at longhirst hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the restaurant is screened from the grounds by frosted glass and outside a corridor runs the length of the restaurant. - it has no soul to it . All very corporate ,cold and clinical. I also thought that at breakfast to charge £3-95 extra if you wanted kippers or smoked salmon and scrambled egg was incredibly mean and nowhere i have previously stayed has done that. The staff were very pleasant and I hope the directors find some way to put heart into the dining room.
reviews.title: Our magical wedding

reviews.text: Well my self and my husband want to say that we have had the most perfect wedding ever imagineable!! What a brilliant venue, stunning grounds, and overall the most perfect package. The staff have been brilliant every time weve visited and our wedding coordinator has been fantastic, very helpful and even willing when I made a strange request of my horse attending the venue for photos late on the wedding day. I was also greeted the evening before the wedding by our toast master Dan, who I must say was the most helpful person ever, he couldnt do enough for us and never stopped once making sure our day was perfect!! He deserves a medal and he easily made what coudlve been the most sressful time of my life into a breeze. Massive massive thankyou Dan!!!!!! your a star and once again thanks very much Loghirst Hal you definately made our day
reviews.title: Gave it another go. . .

description: We specialise in the weddings,conference & training and corporate markets
